Interface Belt.SinkStepSource<In,Out>

public static interface Belt.SinkStepSource<In,Out> extends Belt.Segue<In,Out>
A Segue where the source is a StepSource.

    • compose

      default Belt.StepSource<Out> compose(Belt.StepSource<? extends In> upstream)
      Description copied from interface: Belt.Segue
      Connects the upstream source before this segue. Returns a new source that behaves like this segue's source, except that running it will also run the station formed by connecting the upstream source before this segue's sink.
      Specified by:
      compose in interface Belt.Segue<In,Out>
      Parameters:
      upstream - the upstream source
      Returns:
      a new source that also runs an upstream station

    • compose

      default <T> Belt.SinkStepSource<T,Out> compose(Belt.SinkStepSource<? super T,? extends In> upstream)
      Description copied from interface: Belt.Segue
      Connects the upstream segue before this segue. Returns a new segue that pairs the upstream segue's sink with a new source that behaves like this segue's source, except that running it will also run the station formed between segues.

      This method behaves equivalently to: 

      this.compose(upstream.source()).compose(upstream.sink())
      Specified by:
      compose in interface Belt.Segue<In,Out>
      Type Parameters:
      T - the upstream sink element type
      Parameters:
      upstream - the upstream segue
      Returns:
      a new segue whose source also runs an upstream station

      default Belt.Sink<In> andThen(Belt.Sink<? super Out> downstream)
      Connects the downstream sink after this segue. Returns a new sink that behaves like this segue's sink, except that running it will also run the station formed by connecting this segue's source before the downstream sink.
      Parameters:
      downstream - the downstream sink
      Returns:
      a new sink that also runs a downstream station
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if downstream is null

      default <T> Belt.Segue<In,T> andThen(Belt.Segue<? super Out,? extends T> downstream)
      Connects the downstream segue after this segue. Returns a new segue that pairs the downstream segue's source with a new sink that behaves like this segue's sink, except that running it will also run the station formed between segues.

      This method behaves equivalently to: 

      this.andThen(downstream.sink()).andThen(downstream.source())
